heronarts.lx
Class Tempo

java.lang.Object
  heronarts.lx.Tempo

public class Tempo
extends Object

Class to represent a musical tempo at which patterns are operating. This can be updated in real-time via invoking the tap() method. Quarter-note "beats" are indicated by the return value of the beat() method, and ramp() returns a double value indicating the current 4/4 phase from 0 to 1.

Tempo

public Tempo()
Method Detail

beat

public boolean beat()
Method to indicate when we are on-beat, assuming quarter-notes being given one beat.

Returns:
true if we are on a quarter-note beat

ramp

public double ramp()
Indicates phase of the current beat. On the beat the value will be 0, then ramp up to 1 before the next beat triggers.

Returns:
value from 0-1 indicating phase of beat

rampf

public float rampf()
Indicates beat phase in floating point

Returns:
value from 0-1 indicating phase of beat

bpm

public double bpm()
Returns the current tempo in Beats Per Minute

Returns:
Current tempo

bpmf

public float bpmf()
Returns the tempo in floating point

Returns:
Current tempo in float

adjustBpm

public void adjustBpm(double deltaMs)
Adjusts the tempo by the given amount

Parameters:
deltaMs - Number of milliseconds to nudge beat by

setBpm

public void setBpm(double bpm)
Sets the BPM to the given value

Parameters:
bpm - Number of beats per minute

trigger

public void trigger()
Re-triggers the metronome, so that it immediately beats.

tap

public void tap()
Adjusts the tempo in realtime by tapping. Whenever tap() is invoked the time between previous taps is averaged to compute a new tempo. At least three taps are required to compute a tempo. Otherwise, tapping just re-triggers the beat. It is better to use the trigger() method directly if this is all that is desired.
